contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox book |image=[[File:Your Best Life Now cover.jpg|200px|Book cover]] |caption=Cover for ''Your Best Life Now'' |name=Your Best Life Now |isbn=978-0-446-53275-4 | dewey= 248.4 22 | congress= BV4598.2 .O88 2004 | oclc= 55149452 |pub_date=2004-10-12 |subject=Self-help, religion |publisher=[[FaithWords]] |author=[[Joel Osteen]] }} '''''Your Best Life Now: 7 Steps to Living at Your Full Potential''''' is the [[bestseller|bestselling]]<ref>{{cite web|title=NYTimes.com > Books > Best-Seller Lists|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2005/12/18/books/bestseller/1218besthardadvice.html|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=8 December 2011|date=18 December 2005}}</ref> book by pastor [[Joel Osteen]]. It was published on October 12, 2004 by FaithWords. There is also a calendar, board game,<ref>{{cite web|title=Your Best Life Now: The Game|url=http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/25739/your-best-life-now-the-game|publisher=BoardGameGeek.com|accessdate=8 December 2011}}</ref> and study guide<ref>{{cite book|last=Osteen|first=Joel|title=Your best life now study guide : 7 steps to living at your full potential|year=2005|publisher=Warner Faith|location=New York|isbn=978-0-446-69636-4}}</ref> available based on the book. ==Criticism== Osteen and his book ''Your Best Life Now'' have been criticized for preaching a [[Prosperity theology|prosperity gospel]], which claims that good health and prosperity are promised to Christians.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/05_21/b3934014_mz001.htm |title=Meet the Prosperity Preacher |date=2005-05-23 |work=BusinessWeek |accessdate=2007-12-04 }}</ref> ==References== <references/> [[Category:2004 books]] [[Category:Self-help books]] {{Christian-book-stub}}
